applied_by_id.description: Identifier of the employee who raises the time-off request.

approved_by_id.description: Identifier of the employee who approves the time-off request. Must be a valid employee.id value.

cancelled_at.description: Timestamp of when the employee cancels the time-off request.

cancelled_by_id.description: Identifier of the employee who cancels the time-off request. Same as applied_by_id, if the time_off.status is cancelled.

cancelled_due_to_exit.description: Specifies whether the time-off request is cancelled due to the off-boarding process of the employee.

comments.description: Reason quoted by the employee for the time-off request.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the time-off request is created, specified in the date-time format.

end_date.description: Ending date of the employee’s absence.

id.description: Identifier of the timeoff object, auto-generated when a time-off request is saved.

leave_type_id.description: Identifier the time-off type under which the time-off request is raised. Must be a valid time_off_type.id value

leave_units.description: Number of days of time-off applied through the time-off request, auto-generated considering the organization’s work and holiday calendars and the time-off request’s start_date and end_date.

optional_leave_units.description: Number of days of optional holidays that falls within the time-off request period.

rejected_at.description: Timestamp of when the reporting manager or HR partner declines the time-off request.

rejected_by_id.description: Identifier of the employee who declines the time-off request.

start_date.description: Starting date of the employee’s absence.

status.description:
Status of the time-off request.
Possible values (enum): pending, approved, declined, cancelled

status_comments.description: Reason for declining or cancelling the time-off request.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the time-off request details are last updated, specified in the date-time format.
